title: The $110m star Iniesta’s chosen as his ‘heir’
text:
Paper Talk: Iniesta hints at his ‘heir’, Pep’s relationship with Aguero, Kroos loses skills challenge to teen February 21, 2017 2:25pm by Staff writers with AFP Source: FOX SPORTS THE PSG star Andres Iniesta believes is his “heir”, Pep Guardiola’s current relationship with Sergio Aguero, and Philippe Coutinho can’t match Steven Gerrard. 
It’s all in Tuesday Paper Talk! 
INIESTA AGREES VERRATTI IS HIS ‘HEIR’ 
Paris Saint-Germain completely outplayed Barcelona in the 4-0 Champions League win last week as the likes of Marco Verratti, Angel Di Maria, Edinson Cavani, Julian Draxler and Adrien Rabiot ran riot. 
But during the match Andres Iniesta, 32, also confirmed one of those PSG stars could become his successor. 
When Italian midfielder Verratti, 24, was down injured on the pitch, Blaise Matuidi had an interesting conversation with Iniesta. 
Matuidi revealed to French radio station France Bleu , “When Verratti was on the ground after getting injured, I told Iniesta that he is his heir. 
“And he replied, ‘Yes, I think so too.’” 
Iniesta, who has been one of the world’s best midfielders for the past decade, had only recently returned from injury, but Verratti consistently got the better of him during the match. 
Verratti was linked with a move to Chelsea last year and is valued at $110 million according to Italian outlet Corriere dello Sport. Marco Verratti (L) and Barcelona's Andres Iniesta (C). Source: AP 
GUARDIOLA KEEN TO KEEP PEACE WITH AGUERO 
Pep Guardiola insists his relationship with Sergio Aguero remains strong despite mounting speculation over the Manchester City striker’s future since the arrival of Gabriel Jesus. 
Teenage sensation Jesus took Aguero’s place in Guardiola’s starting line-up before breaking a bone in his foot, an injury that may rule the Brazilian out for the remainder of the season. 
That forced Guardiola to recall Aguero for an FA Cup fifth round draw at second tier Huddersfield on Sunday. 
With just two goals to his name since the end of November, recent events have fuelled the speculation that Aguero, 28, could end his six-year stay with City once the current campaign is over. 
But the City boss insisted he is handling Aguero no differently to at any time in the past. 
“Sergio has enough experience. He knows, everyone knows,” Guardiola told reporters on Monday. Pep Guardiola and Sergio Aguero. Source: Getty Images 
“We are going to talk with him like with all of his teammates. In this level it is so demanding in the Champions League. 
“It is one of the most beautiful competitions to play, maybe not the most important, but the most beautiful and we have to do our best. 
“All of Europe will watch us, to analyse us, to kill us if we don’t win or say how good we are if we do win. That is the huge experience. It is beautiful to me.” And Guardiola has faith in Aguero to rediscover his goalscoring touch. “The guys who score goals, it is talent, instinct. How they have to move, create spaces. He does not need to be controlled like a TV remote control. He is going to do it himself.” 'Mooy is playing amazing' 0:44 
COUTINHO FAILS TRYING TO REPLICATE LEGENDARY GERRARD GOAL 
Steven Gerrard’s late goal against Olympiakos in the Champions League in 2004 remains one of Anfield’s best ever moments. 
It’s the strike that sent Liverpool through the group stages before they claimed the trophy after coming back from 3-0 down against AC Milan. 
Now current Reds star Philippe Coutinho has attempted to replicate his strike - but it didn’t goal very well. A post shared by Liverpool Football Club (@liverpoolfc) on Feb 20, 2017 at 7:13am PST 
TONI KROOS BEATEN BY SKILLED TEEN 
You would think Real Madrid star Toni Kroos could beat any 14-year-old in a juggling competition, but on TV this weekend he got schooled. 
Both competitors had to juggle a ball backwards up a flight of stairs, and while the youngster took on the challenge will relative ease, Kroos struggled. 
On his third attempt the midfielder recorded a time one second slower than the teen and was condemned to defeat. Kroos loses challenge to 14yo 1:05 
PJANIC’S THREE-YEAR-OLD SON JOINS JUVE TRAINING 
Juventus are set to take on Porto in the Champions League this week, but Miralem Pjanic and teammates seem quite relaxed. 
They even had the midfielder’s three-year-old son Edin join in on training. 
He displayed some decent footwork, energy and character - even racing ahead of Paulo Dybala to get ahead of him in the line. A post shared by Miralem Pjanić (@miralem_pjanic) on Feb 18, 2017 at 2:00pm PST 
- Additional reporting with AFP.
